div.head: CHAP. XXII.
div.ab: A Good name is rather to be chosen then great riches, and louing fauour rather then siluer & golde. Eccles.7.2 , Or, fauour is better then, &c.
The rich and poore meet together: the Lord is the maker of them all. Chap. 29. 13.
A prudent man foreseeth the euill, and hideth himselfe: but the simple passe on, and are punished. Chap.27. 12.
By humilitie and the feare of the Lord, are riches, and honour, and life. Psal. 112. 13. , Or, the reward of humilitie, &c.
Thornes and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doeth keepe his soule, shalbe farre from them.
Traine vp a childe in the way he should goe: and when he is olde, hee will not depart from it. Or, catechize. , Heb. in his way.
The rich ruleth ouer the poore, and the borrower is seruant to the lender. Heb. to the man that lendeth.
Hee that soweth iniquitie, shall reape vanitie: and the rodde of his anger shall faile. Iob 4.8. hos.10.13. , Or, and with the rod of his anger he shalbe consumed.
Hee that hath a bountifull eye, shall bee blessed: for hee giueth of his bread to the poore. 2.Cor.9.6 , Heb. good of eye.
Cast out the scorner, and contention shall goe out; yea strife, and reproch shall cease. Psal.101.6
He that loueth purenesse of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend. Or, and hath grace in his lips.
The eyes of the Lord preserue knowledge, and he ouerthroweth the words of the transgressour. Or, the matters.
The slothfull man sayth, There is a lyon without, I shall be slaine in the streetes. Chap. 26. 13.
The mouth of strange women is a deepe pit: he that is abhorred of the Lord shall fall therein. Chap. 2. 16. and 23. 27. and 5.3. and 7.5.
Foolishnesse is bound in the heart of a child: but the rod of correction shal driue it farre from him. Chap. 13. 24. and 19. 18. and 23. 13. and 29. 15, 17.
Hee that oppresseth the poore to increase his riches, and he that giueth to the rich, shall surely come to want.
Bow downe thine eare, and heare the words of the wise, and apply thine heart vnto my knowledge.
For it is a pleasant thing, if thou keepe them within thee; they shall withall be fitted in thy lippes. Heb. in thy belly.
That thy trust may bee in the Lord, I haue made knowen to thee this day, euen to thee. Or, trust thou also.
Haue not I written to thee excellent things in counsailes and knowledge:
That I might make thee knowe the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answere the words of trueth to them that send vnto thee? Or, to those that send thee.
Rob not the poore because he is poore, neither oppresse the afflicted in the gate. Zach.7.10
For the Lord will plead their cause, and spoile the soule of those that spoiled them. Chap. 23. 11. iob.31. 21.
Lest thou learne his wayes, and get a snare to thy soule.
Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts. Chap.6.1. and 11. 15.
If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from vnder thee?
Remoue not the ancient land marke, which thy fathers haue set. Chap. 13. 10. deut. 19 14. & 27.7. , Or, bound.
Seest thou a man diligent in his businesse? hee shall stand before kings, he shall not stand before meane men. Heb. obscure men.
